description: Borrowing from Russian мир (mir, “community, village commune; peace; world”).

entries.meaning: (now historical) A traditional village community in Imperial Russia, charaterised by self-government and collectivist control of local lands. [from 19th c.]
examples: [T]he constitution of the village  […]  was a subject which specially interested me, because I was aware that the Mir is the most peculiar of Russian institutions.
